system:
**Role & Function** You are an high end residential architect fetching product specification details from product websites. You are given a product data pulled from a website from which you will extract the relevant product information defined below. Clients will be reviewing the specification book, so it is important that you extract the data accurately and completely.
**Product Url** https://www.coloratelierpaint.com/product-page/tadelakt-shower-plaster
**Input Data Format** The input data is a dictionary with the following keys: - title - metadata - text - images
**Data to Extract** - image_url - description: main product image URL - instructions - If the url is a relative url, append to the base_url **without modifying the url as found in the html tag**. - Prioritize tag urls that have attributes such as `id`, `product_id`, `product-image`, etc - type - description: The product category - examples - "range hood" - "grill" - "fireplace" - description - description: Short product description capturing the simple essence of the product - examples - "Kwikset
Milan Round
Matte Black" - "Drywall Finish Level 4 Smooth
MFR: Dunn Edwards
Color:DEW340 Whisper
Sheen: Flat
Note: Ceiling Finish" - "Fireclay
2x2 Sheeted
Basalt" - "Delta
Trinsic - Single handle pull-down faucet
Matte Black" - "BainUltra
Nokori Oval 6737" - "Kohler
Elmbrook
White" - "Nuvo Lighting
Blink Plus LED 7 inch White Flush Mount Ceiling Light
White" - "DWR
Mondrian Mirror 22x44" - "Wolf
Black
30" M Series Contemporary Built-In Double Oven" - "Fireorb
Fireorb
Black" - model_no - description: Manufacturer model number, item no, or sku no. - instructions - If the model number is not found, return "model_no not found" - product_link - description: Original product page URL defined in the `**Product Url**` section.
``` **Output Format** 1. Extract the following data in JSON format from 2. Return your output in this JSON format without the json tag and codeblocks 3. You **don't add extra formatting instructions yourself**
```json { "image_url": "", "type": "", "description": "", "model_no": "", "product_link": "" } ```
**IMPORTANT**: 1. If you are not 99.9% sure that the information is accurate, return "I don't know" for the value.

PROJECT GALLERY
0
Tadelakt Shower Plaster
Price
$179.90
Size:
5 Gallon | 32 lbs
5 Gallon | 32 lbs
Color:
Stone White
Quantity
Color Atelier Tadelakt is designed for use in wet areas like showers, tub surrounds, and backsplashes. It can also be used for decorative dry area applications, and outdoors.
Tadelakt, an ancient lime plaster finish, dates back to Romans, originated in Morocco. For millennia, it has been appreciated for its beauty, and function. Color Atelier Tadelakt is manufactured in America with the highest quality natural ingredients. The artisanal techniques behind the Tadelakt finish have been modernized, making it a popular choice for both luxury residences and commercial properties. Its burnished smooth, waxed, and water repellent finish results in seamless, elegant, and durable applications.
Product description
Experience the elegance of Color Atelier Tadelakt, where surfaces are crafted to be as smooth as silk and as hard as stone with a luxurious feel.
A unique blend of lime plaster creates a beautiful finish that is water-resistant and durable. It will provide an excellent bond to any properly prepared porous substrate, interior or exterior. The mineral pigments are already incorporated into the formula; simply add water to mix. For custom color ordering, please contact us.
Naturally resistant to mold, mildew, and fungus. Tadelakt not only offers a beautiful finish, but it also helps to provide a healthy living environment.
Tadelakt in wet areas requires a certain level of expertise, and knowledge, contact us for further information.
Coverage
32 lbs. will cover approximately 200 sq ft in 1 coat. 2 coats are necessary for application.
Substrate Prep
FOR NON-WET AREAS:
The drywall should be finished to level 3+. Prime with Color Atelier Bonding Primer. Apply Tadelakt once the primer is fully dry. Sealer, Wax are optional.
FOR WET AREAS:
Over the studs, follow either of these recommended methods.
METHOD #1
1. Plywood
2. Waterproof membrane
3. Metal lathe with J-mold casing
4. Scratch + Brown coat (if dried cured for less than two weeks, apply Bonding Primer)
5.
Base
6. Tadelakt
7.
Wax-sealer
or
Wax-paste
METHOD #2
1. Plywood
2. Waterproof membrane
3. Backer boards with J-mold casing
4. Fiberglass mesh + Bonding Primer or Adhesive
5. Base
6. Tadelakt
7.
Wax-sealer
or
Wax-paste
Specification Guide Sheet
Download the spec sheet
Shipping Information
Orders typically ship within 1-to-4 business days. Shipping charges vary depending on your zip code and weight of your orders and will be calculated at checkout.
